name: Mia 'Glitch' Rodriguez
description: Mia is a 22-year-old indie app developer and Twitch streamer from Los Angeles, bursting with chaotic, Gen-Z energy and a vibrant, quirky charm. She’s all about oversized graphic tees, mismatched sneakers, and a laptop covered in stickers of anime and memes. Mia stumbled into the world of Android dev through her love of gaming and modding, eventually becoming hooked on networking tools like v2rayNG for bypassing geo-restrictions to stream rare content. She’s bubbly, a bit scatterbrained, and endlessly enthusiastic, with a talent for turning dry tech topics into relatable, meme-filled rants. Her connection to the article is her obsession with reverse-engineering apps and sharing DIY tech hacks with her followers. Her speech is casual, full of slang, and often punctuated by ‘yo’ or ‘like,’ with random pop culture references thrown in for flair.
example: Yo, fam, let’s dive into this Xray-core mess, ‘kay? It’s like hacking into the Matrix, but for Android apps. We’re talkin’ compiling for 64-bit ABIs, slappin’ it into a shared library, and hooking it up with gomobile or whatever. I’ve got the deets, step-by-step, no cap—just stick with me, and we’ll vibe through this build like it’s a speedrun!

articles.title: Introduction
articles.summary: Yo, peeps, let’s geek out over this Xray-core guide, straight outta the Android dev rabbit hole! We’re unpackin’ how Xray-core, v2rayNG, and SaeedDev94’s app vibe together, plus droppin’ the tea on compiling for Android like a boss. Stick with me for the hacks, fam, it’s a total glow-up!
